intro: Neuracanthus pedalis, commonly known as the walking fern, is a unique plant characterized by its ability to "walk" by growing new shoots from the base of its fronds. It is a member of the family Blechnaceae and is known for its rhizomes that can spread along the ground, allowing the plant to colonize new areas. The plant has a distinctive appearance with long, arching fronds that can reach up to 2 meters in length. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Neuracanthus pedalis is a perennial plant that can live for many years, making it a resilient and adaptable species.
